title: Voyageurs National Park: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger         Are you ready to be a Junior Ranger? NPS  What is a Junior Ranger? A Junior Ranger is an important person who helps park rangers take care of our national parks.  Do you like exploring the park, taking boat trips, hiking in park forests, or seeing a bald eagle fly overhead? Would you like to have fun and help us take care of the park? If the answer is yes, then you might be just the kid we're looking for to become our newest Junior Ranger!        Booklets are free.   How do you become a Junior Ranger? You can become a Junior Ranger by completing a Junior Ranger booklet. Pick up a free booklet at any of the three visitor centers or download a Jr. Ranger booklet.  After completing the booklet, present it to a park ranger or volunteer to receive your badge and certificate. Junior Ranger Booklets for download: Voyageurs National Park Junior Ranger  Night Explorer (ages 5-12) Garden Explorer Activity Book (ages 7 and up) You can also mail the completed Junior Ranger booklet to: Voyageurs National Park Junior Ranger Program 360 Highway 11 East International Falls, Minnesota 56649 Make sure your name is on the booklet so we can put your name on your certificate!         WebRangers are explorers who like to learn about national parks. Join the fun today and Be a WebRanger!
